support_summary: RNF8 physically binds ATXN3 in the nucleus (Co-IP and MS evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Regulation of the DNA damage response (DDR) through E3 ligase stability
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 deubiquitinates RNF8 to prevent its proteasomal degradation and works with p97 to extract RNF8 from chromatin, preventing toxic overaccumulation at damage sites.
biological_consequence: DNA damage → RNF8 recruitment and auto-ubiquitination (K48-linked) → p97-ATXN3 complex recruitment (via VBM domain) → ATXN3-mediated deubiquitination of RNF8 → Stabilization of soluble RNF8 pool → p97-mediated extraction of RNF8 from chromatin → Balanced K63-ubiquitin signaling → Efficient DSB repair and cell survival.
specific_effects: Cleavage of K48-linked polyubiquitin chains from RNF8
Prevention of RNF8 and K63-Ub overaccumulation at DSB foci

evidence.paper_title: The p97–Ataxin 3 complex regulates homeostasis of the DNA damage response E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF8
evidence.relevant_quote: ATX3 deubiquitinates RNF8 to protect it from premature degradation... the p97–ATX3 complex facilitates RNF8 chromatin extraction to balance DSB repair pathway choice and improve cell survival to ionising radiation (IR).

mechanism_correction: The mechanism is correctly identified as post-translational stabilization and chromatin extraction. ATXN3 acts as a DUB for RNF8 within the p97/VCP complex.

summary: ATXN3 activates RNF8 to modulate rnf8 homeostasis & chromatin extraction, ultimately affecting efficient dsb repair and cell survival.
